Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please can you provide me by way of documentation, proof that the A57 - Parkway, dual carriageway major road, in and out of Sheffield to the M1 has gone through the relevant consultations and that a full business case was made and approved by the relevant authorities for this to be made.
Yours faithfully,
Chris B

Dear Chris B,
Thank you for your request for information relating to speed reduction
applied to A57 which we received on 25/01/2023.
Unfortunately, Sheffield City Council cannot process your requests because
you have not given us your full name.  Section 8 of the Freedom of
Information Act states that you must give us your full name for a request
to be valid.
Could you please let us know your full name to enable us to process your
request.
For further guidance please see the Information Commissioners Office
Guidance “Recognising a request made under the Freedom of Information Act”
– in particular the section entitled “Name of the applicant”, on the link
below:
[1]
https://ico.org.uk/media/for-organisatio...
In the meantime, please do not hesitate to contact us at the email address
below if you have any queries.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please pass this on to the person who conducts Freedom of Information reviews.
I am writing to request an internal review of Sheffield City Council's handling of my FOI request 'Speed Reduction applied to A57'.
You have failed to respond under law to this FOI
A full history of my FOI request and all correspondence is available on the Internet at this address:
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/s...
Yours faithfully,
Chris Barber

Dear Chris Barber
Thank you for your email of the 24^tMarch 2023, in which you requested a
review of Sheffield City Council’s handling of your Freedom of Information
request. We endeavour to provide a response to internal reviews within 20
working days. However, a review can sometimes be delayed and I apologise
for this.
I can now confirm that a full and impartial review of the handling of your
request has been conducted, with a summary as follows:
You contacted the council on January 25 2023, to request specific details
relating to the speed reduction applied to the A57 and I note that you are
yet to receive a response.
Your email received by the Council on 24 March 2023 explained that you
were requesting an internal review of the handling of your request.
I have reviewed the context of your request and have determined that
firstly, the Council is in breach of the Code of Practice under section 45
of the FOI Act, which requires a response to an internal review within a
month; and we have taken two months to reply. We sincerely apologise for
this, but we have had a significant backlog of requests that is taking us
a long time to get through.
In relation to the details you have requested, I can confirm that SCC
holds no relevant information. I can advise however that this information
is likely to be held by Rotherham Council and should you wish to submit an
FOI request to them, you can use the following link.
[1]Freedom of information request (FOI) | About You - FOI – Rotherham
Metropolitan Borough Council
If you are dissatisfied with my review, you can make a complaint to the
Information Commissioner’s Office: [2][
